zone.line: – Or after life – No, no, I will not per-
suade myself to die, I may not, dare not.
And then I wept; yes, warm tears once
more struggled into my eyes soothing
yet bitter; and after I had wept much
and called with unavailing anguish,
with outstretched arms, for my cruel
father; after my weak frame was
exhausted by var all variety of plaint
I sank once more into reverie, and
once more reflected on how I might
that which I most desired; dear to
me if aught were dear, a death-
like solitude.
I dared not die, but I might
feign death, and thus escape from my
comforters: they will believe me united to
my father, and so indeed I shall be.
For alone, when no voice can disturb
my dream, and no cold eye meet mine
to check its fire, then I may commune
find
